descriptionMarkdown:
https://www.reddit.com/r/factorio/comments/qngyr2/sir_mk_ii_improved_infinitely_tiled_refinery_the/

I wonder if linking this from my comment on reddit, and linking the comments section from here will result in anyone getting stuck in an infinite loop?

\-\-\-

This thing of questionable beauty can be tiled infinitely [so long as fluid flow/additional inputs and outputs permit] in any direction. Do not try to put two copies down next to each other with one rotated 180*, just keep everything lined up.

Is this a good design?

In my opinion, yes. But it's only a 'good design' under the constraint that it be two refineries facing one another with the entire blueprint contained in a 5-tile-wide space that can be tiled infinitely in any direction. If you sacrifice any of these constraints, you can definitely improve the refinery setup.

As far as being practical for taking and using in game? It means you can place it down and connect some things to it, and then expand as needed. It will have a higher material cost, and it will be larger than a purpose-built design, but if you're not worried about UPS or a few hundred iron plates extra cost... What's annoying is having to redesign and rebuild the refinery or building it super huge and not using anything close to what it can produce. So, this actually serves an acceptable purpose.

I 100% could have made it better if the refineries all faced one direction though. Easily, in fact. Almost effortless, really. Wouldn't have been as much fun (and frustrating :P) to fiddle with.
title: SIR [MK II] - Shiverczar's Infinite Refinery
